body.name: GAMEMAX Micro-ATX Tower Computer Case with Removable Dust-Proof Filter, Dual Tempered Glass Side Panels, PC Gaming Chassis (Spark-White)
body.stockDetail: Only 1 left in stock - order soon.
features: Compact Design: small size with high compatibility, basically suitable for installation of all mainstream pc accessories on the market. Support up to 6 fans, MATX/DTX/Mini-ITX motherboard, GPU 355mm (MAX), CPU Cooler Height 168mm (MAX), ATX PSU 220MM (MAX Length) and SSD x 3 & HDD x 1 or SSD x 4.

Excellent Cooling Performance: ertical airflow channel, tbottom fan blows directly to GPU Card, cooling in maximum. Pay attention to the installation direction of the bottom fans for better cooling effect.
Removable Dust-proof top panel, easy to take off and clean; the top grille filter is dust-proof and offers better heat disspation for the case.

Dual 3mm tempered glass side pannels, tool-less design, build system easy and quick. Left side tempered glass by transparent design, right side tempered glass by dark black designed. RGB components showing off the build in panoramic view through an dual tempered glass side panel.

The front panel adopts All-metal design and sandblasting processing, making the pc case looks charming and feels metallic texture. TYPE-C TRANSMISSION:Standard Type-C transmission connector, allowing more options for data transmission, and convenient for users to plug in popular external storage devices.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.5 4.5 out of 5 stars 169 ratings 4.5 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: All-Metal Design Front Panel The front panel adopts All-metal design, sandblasting processing, the texture is visible and touchable. Removable Grille Top Cover Removable grille top cover, dust-proof and heat dissipation, both beautiful and functional. Dual 3mm Tempered Glass Side Panels Dual 3mm tempered glassside panels, tool-less design build system easy and quick (Left side tempered glass by transparent design right side tempered glass by dark black design)

Optimized Rear Cable Management Design The main board plate is provided with 6x holes for cabling which is convenient for the back wiring to be connected from a reasonable position to correspond to the hardware components. A hidden space is also provided on the back panel to facilitate storage of the top fan wire and part of the power cord. Full Area of Dust-Proof Design The grille top cover and the bottom are equipped with a dust-proof filter which can be cleaned regularly to keep the inside of the chassis clean and tidy. Advanced TYPE-C Transmission Feature Standard Type-C transmission connector, allowing more options for data transmission, and convenient for users to plug in popular external storage devices.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compact with airflow options
reviews.reviewText: I love this case, it's amazing....... small enough to fit anywhere with enough airflow to keep most things cool, my processor being the exception......ASRock B450M Steel Legend moboRyzen 9 5900XZotac RTX 3060 12gbEVGA 750w PSU32gb Corsair Vengeance Pro RGB5x Corsair RGB fans with controllerHad to liquid cool the 5900X, that thing is a beast...... Case looks amazing to me, couldn't be happier

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to build in case.Pro’s extremely light so this is a case fairly portable even without a carry handle.Finish Thank you game max for taking away the cringe RGB fest and flat black and leaving a nice gray finish that looks more suitable for businesses, homes, and offices. I can’t wait for a white request from a customer. This case brings that gamers pride of showing their tech, with the professional design.Micro ATX boards are by far the most installed for me personally. I’m going to be recommending this case to customers.USB CExtra screws/standoffs.I used gamemax psu’s back when the Reddit echo chamber mob would mob you for owning one. It’s nice to see this company has evolved from cheap reliable pc parts, to arguable better designs and aesthetics from mainstream brands.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice-looking and very compact case; odd SSD cable routing
reviews.reviewText: This case looks fantastic and is much more compact than my previous case, a Thermaltake Core V21. It also does away with all the problems I had with that case - the feet aren't flimsy plastic things that snap off with the slightest shear force, the panel is glass rather than scratch-prone acrylic, and there's no included fans to be flimsy and loud. The last point does mean that you need to budget in fans, but it also means you can pick the fans you want.Something to note is that the front panel has a USB-C port, but it only uses a USB-3 connection to the motherboard. You can connect your USB-C devices to the front panel, but you will only get USB-3 speeds. On the other hand, that makes it more accessible to older motherboards without the special USB-C connector, and unless you're frequently transferring very large files between external drives it shouldn't matter too much.I only have two gripes with this case:One is that the cable management space is very tight for if you choose to use sleeved cable extensions; I wanted a purple theme, so I got purple extensions, but they make it rather hard to put on the side panel covering the cable tray. I had to put quite a bit of pressure on the panel to make it fit, even after a fair amount of trying to move things around. A few more millimeters of space would have been appreciated for me.The second gripe is that the top cutout for the SSD mounts facing the outside of the case goes straight into your power supply if you have an ATX power supply. I couldn't figure out how I would be able to route them, so I ended up putting both my SSDs in the remaining two slots instead. Maybe I somehow did something wrong, but I don't see how. This shouldn't be a big problem unless you have 4 drives, but it's something to consider.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice PC Case
reviews.reviewText: Overall I love the way the build turned out. Was somewhat challenging when it came to routing case fan wiring. But to be expected with a micro ATX case. I was actually pleased to see everything in it , including the power supply. Extremely pleased 👍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars cable management, space, thermals
reviews.reviewText: good quality case it fits my 4080 msi trio, have to be precise on how to install the 4080 but besides that no problem at all. Thermals are ok as im not overclocking it, i just have a bussing sound on top of the case but that’s because im using i high flow fans on top. Will see if i can custom water cooled everything in this small case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars compact and clean looking
reviews.reviewText: This case is a bit of an adjustment coming from someone who has always built standard ATX or even large style cases, but if you can afford to ditch 3.5 and 2.5 drives and just rely on your m.2 instead, this will be a clean and concise look for your gaming pc

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars MOST UNDERRATED M ATX and ITX PC Case. EVER!!
reviews.reviewText: I understand that this is a copycat of JONSBO D30 or vice versa but I am surprised that none of the YouTubers are talking about this case. It's the best bang for the buck for a semi-small form-factor PC case.For this build, I challenged myself to cram in as much as possible and push this case's limit.The shown picture has the following specs:-Asus B560M-Wifi -Intel i5 11600k -Scythe Fuma 2 -Nvidia RTX 3080Ti -EVGA 850w G2 -4 120mm Arctic Fan. I also have a Hackintosh build in the same exact case (picture not shown) with the following specs: -Asus Z390-i -Intel i7 9700k -140mm AIO liquid cooler -Asrock Taichi 5700XT -EVGA 500w G2 -3 140mm Noctua

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great case! Worst packaging ever.
reviews.reviewText: Case is amazing, best mATX design with full size PSU compatibility. But shipped with a single piece of folded bubble wrap stuffed on one side of the box so it arrived with a massive scratch on the front panel. If whoever packaged it just unfolded the wrap and put around the case it probably would've been fine. But laziness prevailed and thats the reason for stars.

Es un gabinete muy bien pensado y la calidad de la manufactura es muy buena.Solo tengo 3 observaciones que me gustaría que el fabricante agregara/mejorara:-El espacio detrás de la motherboard es limitado, lo que dificulta el manejo del cableado.-El filtro de polvo inferior es una lámina que se encaja en unas cejillas, sería muy bueno modificarlo para que tuviera un riel como cajón para sacarlo por el frente o por atrás.-Es excelente que puedas montar una fuente de poder ATX por aquello que las SFX son más caras, pero estaría buenísimo que tuviera montura para SFX también.Por todo lo demás es excelente, compré 2 de diferente color.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 13, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Extremely good value for money, very little expense spared in manufacturing, considering the price point! Though some might take issue with a molex power connector being used for the ARGB fan board. But really thats picking bones!The side panel is a high quality glass, very shiny! Great for the RGB colours if that's your bag. A single layer pair of dust filters cover the top and bottom PSU shroud, whilst the front intake is covered by a double layer of mesh and dust filters. This enables very good airflow whilst the case stays very resistant to the dreaded dust mites!There is ample room for cable management with 1-2 inches of clearance. Even better if like me, you have nothing but a PCI-E, 8-pin CPU and some front panel connectors connected to the board itself - airflow is extremely good as a result of having such "open plan" space within the case... I'm using a 1tb NVME.The fans are excellent little coolers, operating at quite a low RPM on both the high and low switches, the air-passing efficiency is comparable to any full tower case at double the price. Coupled with a Hyper 212 Black CPU cooler and a freshly cleaned, re-pasted RX 580 (8GB), my R5 2600 (@3.8GHZ) and OC'd 580, have not yet passed 55c and 69c under fairly heavy gaming load.Side note - the heat dissipation is also fantastic, once an intensive game/application is closed, my temps will immediately drop by 20c and then very rapidly decline back to idle temps (GPU @22c and CPU @28c).The ARGB switch board is a great and has a wide array of colour modes for the fans, which acts as a great replacer for mATX boards, considering the lack of pwm connecters associated with mATX.The case comes with all the screws and fittings you'd need and expect, they also offer black cable ties too.All in all fantastic bang for buck with very little to criticise at all. If I had to pick any bones at all I'd highlight the molex power connector for the ARGB board and perhaps a lack of fan switch option's, you have high, off and low... But again, it's kind of irrelevant.

Le puse un cooler de cpu grande que otros cases no cierran y este sí cierra.Tiene mucho espacio para GPU pero actualmente lo uso para los cables xD.La tengo en una build para la RX 6400, nada muy grande.Como tip si vas a comprar los ventiladores, yo le compré unos de 120mm y en la parte inferior (intake) le puse 3 ventiladores, le caben 3 justitos y pues es muuucho más aire, las temperaturas van espectaculares.Me gustó mucho, aunque si le pones los ventiladores inferiores te alcanza a tapar algunos puertos de los sata y demás para que seas paciente instalando.10/10

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 4, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: A Good Case for the Price
reviews.reviewText: The Gamemax Kamikzae Pro is a very good case, prefect for an matx build and has a lot of featues that are just amazing for the price. First off the magnetic dust filters on the top, bottom and front of the case are amazing to keep dust away for your expensive PC parts. It comes with 4 argb fans pre installed and they are wired to the rgb module to controll the colour of the fans with one button on the front of the case. This just awsome for the price as some cases in this price rage may not even come with fans preinstalled. Moving onto the front IO of the case. It features a LED controll button to controll the rgb in the case fans and or anything hooked up to the RGB hub, a pair of USB 2.0 ports and a pair of USB 3.0 ports aswell which is great, headphone and microphone jack, reset switch and a switch to controll the speed of the fans. It alos a PSU shroud so plenty of space the PSU and all unwanted cables. Lots of tie off points making cable management easy, and also a cage for the a hardrive and mounting slots for a SSD. Also enough space at the top of an AIO or liquid cooling loop and pump.The tempered glass side pannel is also cool if you have rgb components to show off, to power the fans it uses a SATA power connecter which is also convenient. Moving onto a couple downsides is that you need to remove the cage to mount a HDD and it only fit mATX motherboard and smaller not ATX or larger. Not a deal breaker for me but should be fine to build a PC in for the first time very consumer friendly.Thanks, Alan

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 14, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Easy to assemble. Had some trouble getting the LED's to work but they are working perfectly now. Only one consistent issue and that's the headset jac. It will be working but then the audio will go funny and I will have to sit there for a few mins putting it back out and in for it to go back to normal.
